Absolutely! One book that I would recommend is called "Ringo Starr and the Beatles Beat" by Alex Cain and Terry McCusker. This book provides an in-depth analysis of Ringo's drumming style and his contributions to the music of the Beatles.

The authors of the book explore Ringo's unique approach to rhythm and his innovative techniques, such as his use of unusual time signatures and his incorporation of sounds from other cultures into his drumming. The book also looks at his collaborations with other musicians and his continued influence on popular music long after the Beatles disbanded.

In addition to the musical analysis, the book includes interviews with other musicians, producers, and engineers who worked with Ringo and the Beatles. It also features rare photos and memorabilia, making it a comprehensive and engaging read for fans who want to learn more about Ringo's musical legacy.

Overall, "Ringo Starr and the Beatles Beat" is a great starting point for readers who are interested in exploring Ringo's music and his contributions to the Beatles' sound.
